column1: Yesterday I presented the Congressional Medal Award to two #VA07 cousins Anneliese and Nicolas. Congratulations to you both! It was wonderful to celebrate this achievement with your families. Your ability to set goals see them through and serve others will take you far. https://t.co/7Fg1uJnBM5

Help us show #VA07's appreciation and gratitude for our veterans! Now through Feb. 7 you can mail or drop off a card at one of our district offices. On Valentine's Day we'll deliver them to veterans and caregivers across Central Virginia! https://t.co/L4VinrPwBN

The men & women who have selflessly defended our nation deserve our highest level of respect & appreciation. Valentines for Veterans is one small way to show #VA07's gratitude! I hope many of you will find time to send a card for a veteran to our district offices. Details👇 https://t.co/9L7Zrl914F

I'm proud to work on this effort with my constituent Mike a veteran military firefighter from Powhatan who represents the best of #VA07. His service overseas and persistent advocacy at home has truly made a difference for his fellow veterans in Central Virginia. https://t.co/f7e7Bpxlcb

Military firefighters risk their lives each day to save our servicemembers. This high-risk work often exposes them to toxic carcinogens. This week I introduced a bill that would help veteran military firefighters get the care they've earned. https://t.co/sCfi1liouR

“At a time of divisive angry partisanship the call to do right by our service members their families and the Constitution is one that can and should unite us.” I’m proud to work together with both Democratic and Republican colleagues on this vital issue. https://t.co/NHnGofGGX1

“Too often military families experience multiple deployments while the rest of us including members of Congress go about our lives disconnected from their sacrifice. Our broken system is failing them.” https://t.co/UMwjQineAS

Today I introduced the Michael Lecik Military Firefighters Protection Act. Rooted in the advocacy of a Powhatan #VA07 veteran this bill would enable veteran military firefighters to be treated at VA facilities for diseases tied to their high-risk work. https://t.co/U2fn84Sc6h

I'm extremely proud to introduce this bipartisan bill in Mike's name and take another step toward securing the health benefits that veteran military firefighters have earned. Thank you to @RepDonBacon for joining me on this important bipartisan effort.

After bringing the issue to my attention Mike and I worked together to craft the Michael Lecik Military Firefighters Protection Act. This bipartisan bill would provide veterans firefighters with the healthcare & retirement benefits they've earned through service.

After his diagnosis Mike found that the VA doesn't recognize the link between military firefighting & certain diseases like cancer. This makes it very hard for veteran firefighters to get the treatment they need. Mike became a fierce advocate on this issue.

Military firefighters are exposed to unique dangers during their work including intense exposure to burning carcinogens. After his service to our country ended Mike was diagnosed with multiple myeloma - a type of cancer linked to his time in our armed forces.

Mike lives in Powhatan #VA07 and like me he's the proud parent of three girls. Mike served our nation as a military firefighter deploying twice to the Middle East. He worked to defend & rescue our troops in truly harrowing high-risk circumstances. https://t.co/YuQAx59vmE

During today's @HouseForeign hearing on Afghanistan I asked about the enormous cost of this 19-year-long conflict to American taxpayers. Moving forward we have a responsibility to ensure that we don't repeat the same mistakes that led to extensive waste and abuse of funds. https://t.co/Zj2Zee7lt9

I thank my fellow Virginian @BobbyScott for his leadership on this legislation and I look forward to working on additional bipartisan solutions that protect & support #VA07 workers and expand opportunity for all Americans.

Today I voted to pass the bipartisan Protecting Older Workers Against Discrimination Act to help protect Virginians against workplace discrimination. This commonsense measure would simply reestablish prior standards to protect workers. https://t.co/kIxG78o2zv

In the wake of the Great Recession many older Americans were forced to continue working longer and retire later than previous generations. Now we’re seeing rising rates of workplace discrimination against this hardworking group. https://t.co/TOf7SR3ZwI

I’m hopeful that this deal can be the first step in reopening Chinese markets. However most tariffs remain in effect - even after this agreement. The administration must not call this a done deal or pause its efforts to end the reckless trade war. https://t.co/jsVIQzOrQ0

As many Americans celebrate today we also thank the advocates in the Commonwealth & across the United States who have worked tirelessly to bring today's #ERA vote to fruition. Your persistence has paved the way for another major step forward in our American pursuit of equality. https://t.co/rNFjB26ds8

We will certainly remember this day in history. As a mom daughter sister proud Virginian and fierce believer in the power & promise of our constitution I'm proud to see the #ERA pass both the @VaHouse and @VASenate today. https://t.co/LG03jyehQf

I will return to this issue over the coming months because I believe it’s vitally important to have a strong clear on-the-record decision-making process when we’re considering sending American lives into harm’s way.

Specifically I’m concerned about how the authorizations of military force passed in 2001 and 2002 have been manipulated and stretched to allow for military actions that Congress never imagined and which might be very far from the original intent of the law.
During my time in the hearing I focused on an issue that is much bigger than any individual incident or administration - the role of Congress in the authorization of war.

Today @HouseForeign held a hearing to learn more about the administration's Iran strategy. Given the impact this strategy can have on U.S. servicemembers I was disappointed that Secretary Pompeo couldn't attend. I look forward to hearing him speak on this before Congress soon.

I'm encouraged to see this recent news from the @EPA. The quality of Virginia's groundwater and surface streams impacts not only #VA07 families and businesses - it also shapes the greater health of the Chesapeake Bay watershed an area spanning six states. https://t.co/qIZHHfbw0k

Today my team answered questions and spoke with #VA07 veterans at the Tri-Cities Veterans Workshop Clinic in Chesterfield.  If you need help navigating an issue with Veterans Affairs don't hesitate to contact us at https://t.co/pjyPm9uO9p or call (804) 401-4110! https://t.co/MPqD5pEkPp

Like every parent with children in school my heart dropped when I heard the report of a possible active shooter at one of our Henrico schools.  Reports are that everyone is safe and I’m grateful to @HenricoSchools & @HenricoPolice for your work keeping our sweet children safe.

As #5G mobile networks become more prevalent we must have a security strategy to match. I'm proud that my bill passed the House last week and I hope the Senate will act quickly to safeguard Americans against spying exploitation and cyber attacks. https://t.co/CT3sbDhTj7

Yesterday I had the opportunity to meet with Virginian @AmeriCorpsNCCC Southern Region leaders and welcome their newest team. Thank you to Team Bayou 5 for all the work you do in our communities and for setting a great example of service! #VA07 https://t.co/BjrrogAzSN
Thank you 5 Star CDL Training School for welcoming me today! I appreciated the chance to learn more about the practical hands-on training you offer Central Virginians. #VA07 https://t.co/6UDPpzBmnt
Congrats on 26 years @Morgan8news! Thank you for keeping Central Virginia informed—and enjoy sleeping in! https://t.co/2NC7y9GAMZ

I'm proud to join my colleague @chelliepingree in expanding voluntary incentives for companies to reduce #PFAS pollution in household items. #VA07 consumers deserve transparency about the products they buy so they can make the best choice for the health of their families. https://t.co/4TR8Losd98

Hundreds of #VA07 constituents have expressed concerns to me about the harmful impacts of #PFAS chemicals. Virginians have rightfully asked for Congress to take steps to lower the existing health risks to their families and their communities and today we took action.

Today’s vote on the War Powers Resolution doesn't change that and it's not enough. It's merely a first step. In Congress we must fight tooth & nail to keep the authorization of war - our most solemn responsibility - from the clutches of partisan hackery. https://t.co/VIWZVofMm3

The truth is that Republican and Democratic administrations alike have been abusing authorizations of military force for 20 years. Some Members of Congress have stood silent when their own party’s president stretched AUMFs to wage war a continent away from the original target.

I voted tonight to affirm that the Executive can engage our armed forces to defend against imminent attack. I also affirmed that the constitutional authority to make war rests with Congress — those who represent the Americans who actually go to war and their families.

Today we welcomed a new spring intern to our DC office. Angela has a keen interest in foreign service and is eager to learn more about how the legislative process works. Welcome Angela and thank you for joining our work for #VA07! https://t.co/pgtb6iMVdf

#VA07 is home to so many dedicated law enforcement officers who consistently put the safety of others before their own. Their selfless vigilance enables the rest of us to work learn play and enjoy our communities in peace. Thank you! #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay https://t.co/Vy55iOsnz3

#5G holds economic promise for many American communities especially in rural areas but it also brings increased risk of exploitation & espionage by the Chinese military and companies like Huawei. I'm proud to see my bipartisan Secure 5G and Beyond Act pass in the House today. https://t.co/lBEAbdazDD

#5G represents a new frontier in cybersecurity. With a comprehensive strategy we can help Americans take advantage of the economic benefits this technology offers while also protecting against foreign influence interference & aggression. https://t.co/6oCZTdtcNs

My bill addresses this threat by requiring a comprehensive strategy for protecting American families companies and government agencies from espionage. It also encourages new R&D to help achieve and maintain a competitive edge for the United States in #5G technology.

Officials in the U.S. and our security partners abroad have already warned that #5G technology could be exploited by the Chinese government to spy on Americans monitor competitor companies and support Chinese military operations.

Adopting #5G can bring tremendous economic opportunity to U.S. communities especially in rural areas that depend on high-speed connections to tap into the 21st century economy. However we must be proactive about combating the security risks that come with this technology.
As Chinese companies like ZTE and Huawei strengthen their control over the global #5G market the threat of foreign influence espionage and interference in American wireless systems grows.

Today both Republicans & Democrats in the House voted to pass my Secure #5G and Beyond Act by 413-3. I'm proud of the strong bipartisan support behind my bill and I want to explain why it's so important to tackle the growing national security challenges posed by 5G networks. ⬇️

Close ties between the Chinese government & companies like Huawei could lead to #5G technology being used to spy on Americans monitor U.S. companies & support Chinese military operations. The House just passed my bill to protect against these growing security threats by 413-3! https://t.co/esSoZnH0nI

Thank you to @HouseForeign and @EnergyCommerce for approving this bill and thank you to my cosponsors @SusanWBrooks @RepOHalleran @RepRooney @RepSlotkin and @RepStefanik for working across the aisle and joining my work on this important national security concern. https://t.co/ty8HUstsJX

The House just passed my Secure #5G and Beyond Act by 413-3! My bill protects the growing mobile networks used by American families businesses & federal agencies against foreign exploitation & espionage. I'm proud to see it pass with bipartisan support. https://t.co/2RP0ZxJ5uv

Yesterday the Senate Finance Committee passed the #USMCA and brought it one step closer to ratification. I hope @senatemajldr McConnell will schedule a full Senate vote as soon as possible. The USMCA cannot become another casualty of political games. https://t.co/JGJq9mmBRy

Thank you @RTDOpinions for unpacking my bipartisan effort alongside @RobWittman. Giving students the flexibility to use their 529 savings in a variety of programs will put certifications & job training within reach for more Central Virginians. https://t.co/vFymDAEfOr
I continue to follow reports on tonight’s missile attack in Iraq & my prayers are with our U.S. servicemembers in Iraq their families back home and our nation.

This move is great news for Central Virginia businesses.   The bill passed 25 to 3 in Committee today & that's a sign of it having strong bipartisan support.    Now the full Senate needs to take up the #USMCA for a vote as soon as possible.   https://t.co/7Osx5M20Iz

As I serve #VA07 in Congress I have a serious responsibility to report back regularly and help keep my constituents informed on the work we're doing for Central Virginia. I hope this 2019 end-of-year report is helpful and informative! Read here: https://t.co/A6PI7CUcYx https://t.co/bL2Fx7VVfF

#VA07 there's still time to apply for a spring internship in our Henrico or Washington office! If you're motivated by serving others and have an interest in public service this could be a wonderful opportunity for you. https://t.co/twhY4eOFKq

In December President Trump signed into law Spanberger’s bipartisan border-security bill to combat drug trafficking and human smuggling networks in Central America’s Northern Triangle — Honduras Guatemala El Salvador and Mexico. https://t.co/2KQ7j445HY

The White House must brief lawmakers on both sides of the aisle as soon as possible on their plan to address the deteriorating situation with Iran. In just a few days we've seen a dramatic rise in the danger to military diplomatic and civilian Americans in the region. https://t.co/VIWG2YbMzP

Thank you @BillFitzCBS6 for sitting down to discuss my first year in the House! From empowering Medicare Part D to negotiate drug prices to authoring a bipartisan border security bill that was signed into law 2019 was busy - but our work on #VA07 priorities is far from over. https://t.co/806MOgrfod
Thank you Mount Olive Baptist Church for welcoming me this morning! It was wonderful to speak with friends both new and old. #VA07 https://t.co/pb3mjP7W7i

Today marks 1 year since I first began serving #VA07 in the U.S. House. I've been fortunate to partner with colleagues on both sides of the aisle and I'm proud of the bipartisan progress we've made on key issues like prescription drug costs. Here's a snapshot of our 2019 work 👇 https://t.co/QzB5IkeQ8k

The administration must brief lawmakers on its rationale for the strike & its proposed next steps to deescalate this dangerous situation. These events reaffirm the need for a concrete strategy that prevents U.S. entry into yet another prolonged spiraling war in the Middle East. https://t.co/sLhYGWaQBo

Americans in Iraq Israel Lebanon Bahrain and Jordan are now at greater risk. We need to take immediate steps to protect U.S. diplomats & servicemembers - especially the diplomats and 5000 U.S. troops already stationed in Iraq - from potential Iranian-directed retaliation.
In the wake of this airstrike I am concerned about both the immediate & long-term repercussions especially as the administration has begun deploying additional U.S. troops. https://t.co/YICr20GK0P

As a former CIA officer who worked counterterrorism issues I know full well that Soleimani had the blood of hundreds of Americans & thousands of others on his hands. Over the decades he built a deadly shadow campaign that destabilized the Middle East. https://t.co/XgdzZ6TrQ2

Happy New Year #VA07! 2019 was full of many firsts and I’m proud of the practical bipartisan steps we took on Central Virginia priorities like lowering the cost of prescription drugs. Here’s to a productive 2020!

My heart is with the dedicated public servants posted at the U.S. Embassy.   Our reaction to the situation in Baghdad needs to be driven by informed diplomacy and informed by intelligence. We must be purposeful and strategic in our response.   https://t.co/Wo7Uy1E3XX

2019 was a busy year in the Seventh District & on Capitol Hill.   If you'd like to learn more about my work in the U.S. House on behalf of Central Virginia be sure to sign up to receive my  eNewsletter.  You can subscribe here 👇  https://t.co/U1hJ5IvRoQ
John Lewis is a living example of strength unwavering courage and resilience.   My thoughts are with him and his family as they prepare for the battle ahead. https://t.co/YO4SiuUKyD

Earlier this year I joined @RodneyDavis & @repdelgado in calling for strong support for the @USDA's rural broadband ReConnect Program.   Last Friday the President signed a budget that includes funding for these critical rural infrastructure projects.   https://t.co/wpj5s5Ztqc
Merry Christmas #VA07! 🎄 To everyone celebrating across our district and to all the servicemembers who are away from their homes & communities today I’m wishing a safe joyful holiday.

A few days ago the President signed into law my legislation to help address the root causes of violence and illegal migration across the Northern Triangle & Mexico.   I’m proud to stand alongside @HurdOnTheHill in leading this effort.   https://t.co/1Q9m8UkB5r
To all our #VA07 neighbors celebrating Hanukkah tonight I hope the holiday is full of peace reflection and joyful time with loved ones! #HappyHanukkah

This week the House passed the #USMCA.   Over the last year I’ve heard repeatedly from Central Virginians about the need to secure long-term market access for exports to Canada and Mexico.   Read more in @RTDOpinions:   https://t.co/JGJq9mmBRy

This week Republicans and Democrats voted to pass the #USMCA a bipartisan trade agreement that ✅ protects relationships with buyers of Virginia exports ✅ brings stability for our crop livestock & dairy farmers ✅ levels the playing field for #VA07 workers https://t.co/2kwF6K3mVI

Our thousands of #VA07 businesses and farms have waited long enough. Yesterday I was proud to join my colleagues from both sides of the aisle in delivering a #USMCA agreement that will provide tangible economic benefits for Central Virginia. https://t.co/3GFhl2wXSk

Congratulations to @VCU graduate student and @virginia_tech alumna Camille Schrier! Thank you for showing young girls in Virginia and across the country one more example of what's possible for women in #STEM fields like medicine and biochemistry.  https://t.co/riqR6DAHD0

I thank the House negotiators the @USTradeRep and administration officials for their work to reach this agreement. I'm proud of the bipartisan progress we've made for farmers manufacturers and business owners in #VA07 and across the U.S. https://t.co/IekqaJgHSJ

All year I've gathered input from Virginia farmers business owners workers & manufacturers and communicated these priorities to the administration @USTradeRep and House negotiators. After months of pushing for a vote I was proud to help pass the #USMCA today. https://t.co/JH7amt35D1

For Virginia farmers business owners and manufacturers this afternoon's #USMCA vote means  ✅ strengthening export markets ✅ securing fair labor and environmental standards ✅ putting our businesses on equal footing with their competitors https://t.co/gqrH6yGG4O

In today's @HouseForeign markup we reviewed a dozen pieces of legislation including efforts to reduce early childhood mortality improve our counterterrorism capabilities and support the people of Nicaragua in their struggle for a democratic government. https://t.co/0dkF6M6BII

As the holidays approach I'm glad we've reached a bipartisan agreement to spare federal employees from another reckless shutdown. This budget reflects both Republican and Democratic priorities and I urge the Senate to act quickly and advance the bill to the President's desk.
8️⃣ I successfully urged the VA to strengthen funding for gender-specific healthcare for women veterans an area of care that is currently severely lacking at many VA facilities.

7️⃣ I fought to protect the #ChesapeakeBay Program a vital effort that works with Virginia and other watershed states to promote environmental sustainability support farm conservation initiatives and advance shared public health goals.

6️⃣ I successfully advocated for a 25% increase in investment for the Summer #EBT program that keeps children from going hungry when school is not in session. Our #VA07 kids can't grow play or learn when they're hungry.

5️⃣ I requested additional federal investment in apprenticeship programs in Virginia and across the U.S. and succeeded in securing that funding. I've seen the incredible work being done in our #VA07 job training programs and I'm proud to support our students and educators.

4️⃣ I helped secure $350 million in additional funding for Alzheimer's disease research and an increase for the cutting-edge work at @NIH. These investments will go to the world-class American researchers who work 24/7 to find cures & treatments for devastating illnesses.

3️⃣ I successfully fought to block a pay raise for members of Congress. It's entirely inappropriate to consider a raise for Congress while so many Americans are still struggling to cover basic necessities like prescription drugs housing groceries and their children's education.

2️⃣ I helped repeal the Health Insurance Tax. This fee added an unnecessary increase to healthcare costs for many Virginians and repealing it is one practical step we can take to reduce healthcare costs.

1️⃣ I successfully fought to protect investments in #RuralBroadband infrastructure through the @USDA's ReConnect grant program. Many counties in #VA07 have applied for ReConnect to expand access for rural communities and I'm glad we were able to secure this continued investment.

This week I joined Republicans & Democrats in passing a bipartisan budget deal that includes several big wins for #VA07 families veterans students & seniors. Many of the provisions I fought for were included in the bill. More details in the thread. ⬇️  https://t.co/ZXJiJ2rGzI

I'm proud to amplify the voices of #VA07 ag producers through my work on @HouseAgDems. Yesterday Louisa cattleman Irvin White shared his expert insight on USDA outreach for beginning farmers and ranchers. I thank him for his time! https://t.co/cqjvR2dcXF

On Saturday I had a great roundtable with Virginia @alzassociation advocates. Motivated by talks like this I recently helped secure an additional $250 million in funding for #Alzheimers research during the appropriations process. It's an honor to fight for #VA07's top concerns! https://t.co/5OkQ7ZpAoj

During today's @HouseAgDems Conservation and Forestry subcommittee hearing we heard from Louisa #VA07 cattleman Irvin White and other expert witnesses about how we can make federal ag & conservation programs more accessible realistic options for farmers from all backgrounds. https://t.co/jaVKU4KHTv

Beginning farmers women racial minorities and veterans are key contributors to today's farm economy. Historically these groups have lacked access to many of the programs designed to support Americans in agriculture. https://t.co/0cMvUldoBL
If you're passionate about serving #VA07 visit the link below for more information on spring internships in our Henrico or Washington office! ➡️ https://t.co/twhY4eOFKq

In #VA07 nearly 100000 of our neighbors get their prescription drugs through Medicare Part D. I recently helped pass a bill to empower #Medicare to negotiate  lower drug prices because I know Central Virginians are fed up with being gouged at the pharmacy counter. https://t.co/PT3yKsaKHT

I have studied the articles of impeachment both Republican and Democratic reports deposition transcripts and public testimony. With a heavy heart and a solemn devotion to our Constitution I will vote in favor of both articles. Read my full statement: https://t.co/yDm7KvlDD3 https://t.co/3gdP6O7mnK

Working Virginia families can't afford another reckless government shutdown and my colleagues on both sides of the aisle should commit to working together to pass a FY2020 budget. Americans deserve better than another unstable short-term resolution.  https://t.co/1Snq8EYt5Y

The cost of prescription drugs is the top concern for families & seniors in my district. All year I've been working hard to shed light on this murky industry pass bipartisan bills to lower prices and translate the stories I hear from #VA07 into action. https://t.co/D3VV9MxIHf

Over the past few days I've been finishing up letters to #VA07 students who applied for a nomination to one of the five U.S. Military service academies. I'm so proud of these remarkable Virginians who have decided to prioritize public service in their lives at such a young age. https://t.co/mGmnoSLGBa

Thank you to @ALZ_GRVA for a conversation focused on the need for high-quality care investment in research and increased community awareness.   This challenging disease impacts so many families in our area and these advocates are standing in solidarity with those affected. https://t.co/ScvrJreIG5

As Chair of the Conservation & Forestry Subcommittee I know that conservation efforts help build a sustainable and successful economy.   Thank you to @VCNVAorg and its partner network for meeting with me today and for strongly advocating on behalf of #VA07’s natural resources. https://t.co/oojXBBueTj

According to a 2018 report  prices of the 20 most-commonly prescribed brand-name drugs for seniors have increased at a rate approximately 10-times higher than inflation over the past five years.   Yesterday I voted to give Medicare the power to negotiate drug prices. https://t.co/98zCnI929S

The concept of No Budget No Pay  is simple: if Congress can't pass a budget and can't fund the government Members shouldn't be receiving a salary.   I was glad to join this bipartisan & bicameral letter calling for its inclusion in an end-of-year spending package. https://t.co/ijFVtQUoiT

From 2012 to 2017 the average annual cost of prescription drug treatments in Virginia increased by nearly 60 percent while the annual income only increased by 8.5 percent.  Yesterday I took action to lower costs for Central VA families & seniors.  https://t.co/D3VV9MxIHf

We need to prepare our students and workers for 21st-century careers.   That’s why I’m proud to work with @RobWittman to allow 529 savings plans to cover workforce training & credentialing programs.   Thanks you @NewsInTheBurg for highlighting our bill!   https://t.co/nY5fy0Sn3K

Virginians are being gouged at the pharmacy counter. At my drug prices forum in Henrico I heard about the awful decisions #VA07 seniors & families have to make because of skyrocketing costs. Today I was proud to take action by passing #HR3. https://t.co/eNH3w51VWc

Virginians should NOT be paying tens of thousands of dollars more for identical medications compared to citizens of other developed nations. I'm proud to help pass #HR3 in the House today and I strongly urge the Senate to take action and fight to lower crippling drug costs. https://t.co/o7qo6xsAPF

Here are some of the commonsense provisions in #HR3: 💊 Empower #Medicare to negotiate directly with drug companies 💊 Crack down on drug companies' abusive practices 💊 Help reverse decades of unfair price hikes on drugs that treat common conditions like diabetes & breast cancer

For years rising drug prices have put a severe strain on many #VA07 seniors. Today I helped pass the Lower Drug Costs Now Act to empower #Medicare to negotiate directly with drug companies and put a cap on out-of-pocket drug costs for beneficiaries. https://t.co/ItrKGOYBwS

Lawmakers beholden to the pharmaceutical lobby have long refused to act on the unbearable drug costs plaguing Americans. Today I voted to pass #HR3 because I know the hard choices #VA07 residents have to make to be able to afford medications they need. https://t.co/gpH0VbUkH9

Don't forget tomorrow is the deadline to apply for a Spring 2020 internship in my DC office! If you have a strong work ethic & are motivated to serve others we want to hear from you. Apply for this paid opportunity at https://t.co/pjyPm9dcKP!

By cutting down on red tape creating a new year-round guest worker program & stabilizing the existing workforce this bill reflects the needs of farmers in #VA07 and across the country. I hope the Senate will take it up for a vote soon.  https://t.co/3aWP5T6msi

My legislation with @HurdOnTheHill to combat Central American drug trafficking & human smuggling networks and strengthen our border security has passed the House in the #NDAA and is expected to be signed into law by the President.  https://t.co/koS3UrhnL6

Through bipartisan compromise we've crafted #NDAA legislation in the House that meets many of the White House's top goals represents the priorities of our constituents and gives our American servicemembers the full support they deserve. I'm proud to vote for this bill.

✅ Repeal of the Widow's Tax ✅ Robust emergency disaster recovery support ✅ Oversight to address private military housing reform ✅ Prevention of an American withdrawal from #NATO ✅ Creation of #SpaceForce as a branch of the U.S. Military

Today I voted to pass the bipartisan #NDAA. Here are some of the provisions in the bill: ✅ My border security measure with @HurdOnTheHill  ✅ My amendment with @RepMarkMeadows to crack down on child sexual exploitation ✅ Biggest pay raise for our troops in a decade

The #NDAA just passed the House with strong bipartisan support and it includes THREE of my amendments! I'm proud to help pass this legislation that fully supports our military and national security goals. Here are the details on what's in this major bipartisan defense bill ⬇️

For months I've been meeting with the players involved in #USMCA negotiations to advocate for #VA07's businesses farms and workers. I hope the administration and House leadership won't delay in drafting & voting on the final implementation language. https://t.co/NhvZTx6gjf

It's beyond time for Congress to face up to the #NationalDebt. I've repeatedly pushed for the House to follow "pay-as-you-go" rules and I'm working across the aisle with my colleague and fellow @UVA alum @RepChipRoy to put the issue of fiscal responsibility front & center. https://t.co/C0X5JduP3f

During today's @HouseAgDems member day I had the chance to speak more directly to my colleagues about the continued need for  ✅ #RuralBroadband access ✅ rural infrastructure investment  ✅ immigration reforms for ag businesses ✅ fast progress on the final steps of the #USMCA https://t.co/f6daeljEzF

Applications for our next round of DC internships are due on Friday! We've been fortunate to have many outstanding students join our team this year and I'm looking forward to meeting our next group! https://t.co/tLTsxW36k4

I'm proud to work on legislation that provides more of our #VA07 students with the hands-on experience mentorship career training and guidance counseling they need to pursue higher education or thrive in the workforce.  https://t.co/YrffbUDbuO

“In the face of the partisan gridlock gripping our nation’s capital we are on the cusp of a historic opportunity to make legislative progress on one of the toughest policy issues of our time.” https://t.co/zkwWMZWbOn

These photos are a visceral warning of what can happen when we allow the growth of an AI-driven surveillance state. We must take China to task for its use of repressive technologies and its dismal human rights record against the the #HongKongProtesters #Tibetans and #Uighurs. https://t.co/07MBAZTzUE

During today's @HouseForeign hearing on human rights abuses in China attendees held photos of loved ones who've been detained in so-called reeducation camps. The people looking back from these images lived ordinary lives working and raising families before they were taken. https://t.co/4WqiIyxpqq

Thank you to former VA Sen. John Watkins and @American_Hort for highlighting this bipartisan bill! This legislation would:  🌾 Create a year-round H-2A visa program  🌾 Acknowledge the need for border security  🌾 Treat agricultural workers with dignity  https://t.co/zkwWMZWbOn

Building a stable thriving regional economy for tomorrow means investing in education & workforce training opportunities for our kids today. I'm excited to work on the Freedom to Invest in Tomorrow’s Workforce Act with my fellow Virginian @RobWittman. https://t.co/csen7uG6mW

#VA07 businesses & farms have waited patiently for this day and I thank everyone involved for their persistence in reaching a final #USMCA deal. Now we need to receive implementing language from the White House & quickly move it to the floor for a vote. https://t.co/zzjl1k43y7

The new #USMCA agreement will expand export markets & bring greater long-term stability to farms businesses and workers across Virginia. I thank the administration officials House negotiators and trade representatives who have worked persistently to reach this point. (4/4)

— and I am immensely grateful to our district’s servicemembers veterans and their families. I am inspired by their dedication to a common purpose their unbreakable resolve and their sense of civic duty. (6/7)

#ICYMI Last night the House passed my #PBM prescription drug bill by an overwhelming majority. I'll keep working until this bipartisan bill supported by 403 House members gets a vote in the Senate. #VA07 constituents can't afford to wait for lower prescription drug prices. https://t.co/qdoQo5oq6g

#VA07 I have exciting news! At our prescription drug roundtable & town halls many of you told me your concerns about the murky role that #PBMs play in driving up prescription drug costs. Tonight I did something about it: getting a #PBM bill passed in the House by 403 to 0. https://t.co/UrfSJENx8s

My constituents in #VA07 deserve to know what's going on behind closed doors to drive up their prescription drug costs. My bill works to shed light on the role that #PBMs play in these negotiations. Transparency is Step One in fighting the prescription drug affordability crisis.

My bill the Public Disclosure of Drug Discounts Act would require #PBMs to publicly disclose the discounts and rebates they receive from drug companies so pharmacists insurers & patients can see for themselves how prescription drug prices are being inflated.

No one in my district of #VA07 – or anywhere else in the country – should be forced to silently accept the undisclosed results of #PBM negotiations that could be bankrupting them and having permanent consequences for their health and their families. https://t.co/cZGMhjEMBy

During my prescription drug roundtable in #VA07 I heard firsthand from Virginians concerned about the power of #PBMs. One local pharmacist described how PBMs continue to enjoy record profits while patients & pharmacists get stuck with unsustainable costs. https://t.co/eNH3w51VWc

Despite their size and power #PBMs largely remain a mystery. Effectively they’re a black box in the long supply chain from pharmaceutical companies to patients. There's little accountability or transparency into the rebates and discounts PBMs receive from drug companies.

In addition to the huge amount of control they have over the prescription drug market #PBMs take in enormous profits. In 2016 PBMs saw an estimated $22.6 billion in profit. In 2017 alone Express Scripts – America’s largest PBM – raked in more than $4 billion in profits.

Pharmacy benefit managers or #PBMs are essentially middlemen in the prescription drug supply chain. The 3 biggest PBMs in the country are Express Scripts CVS Caremark and Optum Rx – and they control almost 3/4 of the ENTIRE American prescription drug supply chain.

I'm proud to see my bill the Public Disclosure of Drug Discounts Act pass the House tonight with overwhelming support from both Republicans and Democrats – a vote of 403 to 0! See the thread for more details on my bill and how it works 👇 https://t.co/cZGMhjEMBy

Thank you @RepBrendanBoyle & @RepArrington for joining my effort to demystify this murky area of prescription drug costs. We can't make long-term progress for #VA07 & patients across the U.S. unless we work together and I'm proud that my bill has overwhelming bipartisan support.

PASSED! The House just passed my bill the Public Disclosure of Drug Discounts Act by 403 TO 0! My bill will shed light on the deals #PBMs make with drug companies and start to address one of the root causes of our prescription drug affordability crisis. https://t.co/cZGMhjEMBy

While we should always safeguard the full faith & credit of the United States we must also work in a bipartisan way to pursue a clean debt ceiling bill address the disparity between our revenues & spending as a proportion of our GDP & build a pathway toward a balanced budget.

One of the responsibilities I take most seriously as a member of Congress is getting our financial house in order. Our children in #VA07 will have to repay this debt one day. That’s not only unjust – it’s crippling to their future economic prospects & weakens our nation.

This bill would add about $1.5 to $2 trillion to our national debt over the next decade. There are many reasons our debt and deficit continue to climb – including the misguided 2017 tax bill – but until someone says “enough is enough” we will be no closer to a solution.
Yesterday the House voted on budget legislation. I voted against this bill – H.R. 3877 – and I wanted to take a moment to give you some more background on my decision. 👇

The #ButchLewisAct is crucial to workers & retirees across our district. Yesterday I helped pass the bill & spoke with Tim & his colleagues from Virginia NUCPP. One-on-one conversations like these are invaluable to me when I'm considering different legislative paths. https://t.co/ZBY6ZepJRn

The #ButchLewisAct is about standing with #VA07's truck drivers manufacturers electrical workers contractors & workers in dozens of other industries. I'm proud to help pass this bill for Central Virginia workers and I urge the Senate to act now and bring it to a vote.

I cosponsored & helped pass the #ButchLewisAct because the bill would ✔️Stabilize these endangered multiemployer plans ✔️Prevent harsh cuts to benefits that could impact the financial stability of millions of American workers seniors and their families in #VA07 and beyond

...why are these plans collapsing? Mainly due to the 2008 financial crisis and the Great Recession. Multiemployer pension plans were hit hard and simultaneously many workers lost their jobs. #ButchLewisAct

There are about 1400 multiemployer pension plans covering about 10 million workers & seniors across the U.S. (including many in #VA07). Many of these plans are now facing collapse & millions of retirees workers and families would lose benefits through no fault of their own...

Central Virginians who work hard for decades play by the rules and save responsibly for their retirement should never be unfairly punished for mismanagement of their pensions. Here’s some more information about the #ButchLewisAct: https://t.co/ap7tjaX5C5

PASSED❗Last night the House passed the #ButchLewisAct. I was proud to cosponsor this important bipartisan bill to make sure that #VA07’s workers and retirees get the pension benefits they’ve earned. https://t.co/EUGeuupkOP

I will not stop fighting for practical policies that bring relief & stability to our #rural communities and Central Virginia's agricultural producers. My final point – if you ate today thank a farmer. #VA07

The agricultural census is a collection of data but behind each number is a story. #VA07 farmers are facing significant challenges from every side. Just last week Powhatan lost its last dairy operation. https://t.co/3YPqH4pL7M

Small farms also stand to benefit greatly from expanded #RuralBroadband access. When margins are tight & production is small it’s crucial that farmers can use the most efficient cost-reducing technology promote & build a customer base online and file claims with USDA on time.

Avg. net cash farm income is just $24791. That’s below the federal poverty line for a family of four. Farmers in #VA07 are dealing with plummeting profits & market uncertainty. We should be working to provide stability - not baiting other nations into retaliatory #tariffs.

Almost half of the farms in #VA07 are under 50 acres and 96% of the farms in our district are #FamilyFarms. Having a strong farm safety net is critically important to helping these small family farms stay financially viable.

The @USDA recently released the #VA07 data from the 2017 Agricultural Census. This is the most recent available data on farms farmers and crops in #rural Central Virginia. A few points about our communities that stood out to me:

Our work does not stop here. We reacted urgently to a pressing need but now Congress must take action to address the roots of this crisis ensure we demonstrate our American values in how we fix our immigration policy and always — always — protect children.
We have a responsibility to address this massive humanitarian and national security failure along the southern border and we do not have time to accommodate inaction.

Yesterday the U.S. Senate overwhelmingly passed this exact bill with 84 bipartisan votes and I stand with Virginia’s U.S. Senators @MarkWarner and @timkaine in passing this legislation out of the U.S House today.

This funding package would protect children in U.S. custody improve conditions at detention facilities strengthen our border security and authorize hiring additional immigration judges — so that we can expedite the massive case backlog in our immigration courts.

The bicameral bill I helped pass today is an emergency bill meant to alleviate the widespread effects of this humanitarian crisis and to provide urgent assistance to those who are desperately suffering.
Congress must do more to address the increasingly dire conditions facing children in U.S. custody and those detained near the southern border.

As a Virginian & member of @HouseAgDems I’m proud to support much-needed help for our Southern & Midwestern neighbors in today’s #DisasterRelief bill. The bill helps ✅Rebuild rural infrastructure  ✅Repair damaged military facilities ✅Support farmers hit by natural disasters

Today's tariff hike is a direct threat to the livelihoods of #VA07's soybean growers. Central Virginia's farmers consumers and #rural communities need certainty right now - not an erratic escalating #TradeWar. https://t.co/Mmr55AO8F6
As a Member of the @HouseAgDems I’m committed to standing with our Central Virginia growers—and I’ll keep speaking out against decisions that negatively impact family farms across the country.

When we raise tariffs against Chinese goods they retaliate against our exports such as soybeans. In our district I’ve heard from soybean growers who are increasingly worried about the trade war’s harmful effects such as unsold stocks loss of markets and depressed prices.

Above all else our farmers need certainty. Particularly at a time when net farm income continues to decline we need to be supporting policies that protect the financial security of farm families not jeopardize access to critical markets.
For Central Virginia today’s #tariff hike is a direct threat to the livelihoods of our district’s soybean growers who are responsible for one of the Commonwealth’s most important exports.
Right now America’s farm families consumers and rural communities are footing the bill for a #tradewar that continues to escalate with no end in sight.

Past tragedies have made it horrifically clear what can happen when we choose to divide classify and target others based on their religion or skin tone or accent. Our visit to the @VaHolocaust Museum reminded me of why I am proud to be an original cosponsor on the #NoBanAct.
These common elements are EVERYWHERE in modern America not just in our history books.

Look at the story of the Gross Breesen students – the anxiety about whether they have the skills needed to relocate. The rise of hatred & persecution against a religious minority. The persistent battle to obtain a visa. The depth of patriotism for an adopted nation.

The @VaHolocaust Museum does the critically important work of teaching us about the past but they also bring these issues into the present. Human rights violations are occurring every day in every corner of the globe.

During our visit we also spent time with a Holocaust survivor and heard his family’s compelling story of survival. I had met him previously but this was the first time I had the opportunity to hear his entire story. It is a chance I am deeply thankful for.
The Gross Breesen students and the Thalhimer family remained in contact for many years.

Hyde Farmlands was eventually sold but the students went on to serve in the U.S. military as soldiers and linguists during the war. Some of them experienced the liberation of Buchenwald concentration camp where they themselves had been prisoners just a few years before.

In 1939-1940 after a lengthy legal battle the Thalhimer family of Richmond succeeded in securing visas for 21 Gross Breesen students. On the eve of World War II these Jewish students arrived in Central Virginia from Germany and founded Hyde Farmlands.

In 1936 the German Jewish community created an agricultural training institute called Gross Breesen to teach Jewish young people skills they might need to successfully flee the country as the Nazis gained power.

Yesterday I joined the students of Matoaka Middle School for their tour of the @VaHolocaust Museum. We learned the incredible story of Hyde Farmlands which was located in Burkeville in #VA07's Nottoway County. https://t.co/vnpMCOgmp6

UPDATE: My amendment requiring accurate #rural broadband access mapping will be added to the #SaveTheInternet Act. Central Virginians' opportunities should not be determined by their zip code. I will continue working to bring 21st century infrastructure to every part of #VA07.

Every single person in #VA07 deserves an equal chance to succeed in today’s digitally-driven economy. No one’s access to basic 21st century infrastructure should be determined by their zip code and I will continue to demand accurate comprehensive #rural broadband mapping.

Today I am proud to introduce an amendment to the #SaveTheInternet Act that would require the Government Accountability Office to investigate how the FCC maps #rural broadband access. These maps which are used to determine funding for broadband projects are often inaccurate.

#VAWA-supported resources are all around us serving Americans in every state & from every walk of life. The list above is only a small portion of the programs & protections the law extends to victims of domestic and sexual violence & I am proud to support reauthorizing #VAWA19.
✔️Legal Assistance for Victims Program (strengthens civil & criminal legal assistance)  ✔️#Disabilities Program (helps increase organizations’ capacity to help deaf & disabled victims)

✔️State & Territorial Coalitions Program (supports battered women shelters)  ✔️Justice for Families Program (handles cases of alleged child sexual abuse) ✔️Improving Criminal Justice Response Program (strengthens coordination between different levels of law enforcement)

✔️Underserved Program (reaches underserved populations like #rural communities)  ✔️Campus Program (helps college-campus victims across the U.S.)  ✔️Culturally Specific Program (targets prevention & treatment for local communities)

✔️Tribal Coalitions (addresses the high rates of violence among tribes) ✔️Abuse Later in Life Program (addresses elder abuse) ✔️Consolidated Youth Program (promotes men & boys’ role in preventing violence against women & girls)

✔️Rural Program (supports projects uniquely suited to help rural America) ✔️STOP Grant program (helps local #LawEnforcement & prosecutors) ✔️SASP Grant program (supports rape crisis centers) ✔️Transitional Housing Assistance Program (helps victims who leave their home for safety)

Constitutionally it is Congress that has the authority to appropriate money and the President’s efforts to sidestep that authority and the checks and balances process that authority represents is deeply concerning. (4/4)
Additionally the president’s unilateral action of declaring a national emergency actually jeopardizes our national security by pulling critical funding from our military. (3/4)

Notably it comes after Congress successfully conducted bipartisan bicameral negotiations that resulted in the passage of a bipartisan appropriations bill last night—legislation that funds the government and provides for border security investments. (2/4)
This emergency declaration is a reckless knee-jerk decision that sets a troubling precedent and this declaration fundamentally undermines the constitutional authority of Congress. (1/4)

17- We must demonstrate a willingness to collaborate and compromise as we serve the people we were elected to represent.
16- We are indeed stronger as a country when Congress and the President work together to move us forward and our challenges are simply too large to sit idle in our corners.

15- This commitment to bipartisan engagement includes pushing to prevent another senseless government shutdown. I support discussions about strengthening our security but we can do so without shuttering the government and subjecting the federal workforce to additional pain.

14- We need to focus on substantive evidence-based policy—not just rhetoric. During my first month in Congress I’ve participated in bipartisan discussions on issues as vital as the security of our borders and ports of entry including at the White House.

13-However in Central Virginia I have heard from many farmers about the negative effects of the ongoing trade war. As we approach planting season farmers desperately need certainty & I hope the administration will help provide the necessary assistance to sustain farm families.

12- As a member of the @HouseAgDems I wanted to hear more from the President about his priorities for our rural communities. In his speech the President did discuss ongoing trade negotiations between the United States and China.

11- And as a member of the @HouseForeign Affairs Committee I will continue to stress the vital work of the diplomatic and intelligence communities because I am concerned about the President’s continued criticism of these dedicated public servants.
10- By championing strong global partnerships we can continue to keep our communities safe.

9- President Trump also addressed our national security priorities. As a former CIA case officer I will continue to support a robust national security strategy and we need to make sure this strategy includes working with our allies to promote global stability.
8- While I agree with this priority we must also protect reliable healthcare coverage for millions of Americans including those with pre-existing conditions.

7- The President also rightfully discussed the staggering costs of prescription drugs. We need to work together to reduce prices because working families the elderly and the disabled should never have to choose between remaining healthy and putting food on the table.
6- Last week I called on House leadership to prioritize infrastructure improvements so we can repair roads and bridges strengthen broadband internet access and modernize transportation networks.
5- I agree that we must promote job growth and economic development by investing in infrastructure in Central Virginia and across the country.

4- Tonight President Trump advocated for increased bipartisanship—and I hope he intends to follow through on this commitment with concrete actions. In his speech the President spoke about the need to pursue a bold bipartisan infrastructure package.
3- Instead it has fostered distrust in our system of government—and the record-long government shutdown was a testament to Washington’s ineptitude. The people of #VA07 just want us to do our jobs.
2- For Central Virginians this brand of politics has not contributed in any meaningful way to lowering healthcare costs increasing economic opportunity or supporting the next generation of workers.
1- My thoughts on tonight’s State of the Union:  Across the country Americans have witnessed the detrimental effects of hyper-partisanship.
